title: Epic: Claude Code Log Viewer TUI
description: Feature branch: 001-claude-code-log-viewer. High-performance TUI to view Claude Code JSONL logs in real-time or for post-mortem analysis. Displays main agent and subagent conversations in split panes with tabs, supports live tailing, search, statistics, markdown rendering with syntax highlighting. Target: 60fps rendering, <500ms latency. See specs/001-claude-code-log-viewer/ for full specification.

title: Eliminate all panic!, unwrap, and expect from production code paths
description:
Audit all production code paths to ensure:
- No panic!() macros
- No .unwrap() calls
- No .expect() calls (these are just unwrap with a message - still panics)
- No array indexing that could panic (use .get() instead)
- No integer overflow operations

ALL errors MUST be handled via:
- Result<T, E> return types
- thiserror's #[derive(Error)] with From implementations
- The ? operator for propagation

Reference: Constitution Principle IV (Total Functions and Railway Programming)

This is a quality gate requirement: public functions MUST NOT use partial operations.
close_reason:
Eliminated all panic-prone operations from production code:
1. Added saturating arithmetic for 8 integer operations in view/message.rs (commit 34dba5c)
2. Removed dead code PricingConfig::merge() with todo!() stub (commit 27299bc)
3. Added SessionId::unknown() to eliminate .unwrap()/.expect() from fallback (commit f09fc7e)

Verification: Zero panic!/unwrap/expect/todo!/unimplemented! in production code (test code still uses them appropriately). All 710 tests pass.
